Model for single time period

yaâˆ¼Poisson(Î³awa)\begin{equation} y_a \sim \text{Poisson}(\gamma_a w_a) \end{equation}

logÎ³a=Î²aage\begin{equation} \log \gamma_a = \beta_a^{\text{age}} \end{equation}

Priors for age effect Î²aage\beta_a^{\text{age}}:

Case 1: Second-Order Random Walk

Î²aageâˆ’Î²aâˆ’1ageâˆ¼N(Î²aâˆ’1ageâˆ’Î²aâˆ’2age,Ïƒage2),a=2,â‹¯,A\begin{equation} \beta_a^{\text{age}} - \beta_{a-1}^{\text{age}} \sim \text{N}\left(\beta_{a-1}^{\text{age}} - \beta_{a-2}^{\text{age}}, \sigma_{\text{age}}^2\right), \quad a = 2, \cdots, A \end{equation}

where

Ïƒageâˆ¼N+(0,sage2)\begin{equation} \sigma_{\text{age}} \sim \text{N}^+(0, s_{\text{age}}^2) \end{equation}

Case 2: Spline

ğ›ƒage=ğ—ğ›‚Î±aâˆ’Î±aâˆ’1âˆ¼N(Î±aâˆ’1âˆ’Î±aâˆ’2,Ïƒage2)\begin{align} \pmb{\beta}^{\text{age}} & = \pmb{X} \pmb{\alpha} \\ \alpha_a - \alpha_{a-1} & \sim \text{N}\left(\alpha_{a-1} - \alpha_{a-2}, \sigma_{\text{age}}^2\right) \end{align}

where

Ïƒageâˆ¼N+(0,sage2)\begin{equation} \sigma_{\text{age}} \sim \text{N}^+(0, s_{\text{age}}^2) \end{equation}

Model for multiple time periods: Main effects

yatâˆ¼Poisson(Î³atwat)logÎ³at=Î²aage+Î²ttime\begin{align} y_{at} & \sim \text{Poisson}(\gamma_{at} w_{at}) \\ \log \gamma_{at} & = \beta_a^{\text{age}} + \beta_t^{\text{time}} \end{align}

Priors for age effect Î²aage\beta_a^{\text{age}} same as for single-time-period model

Prior for time effect:

Î²ttimeâˆ¼N(0,Ïƒtime2)\begin{equation} \beta_t^{\text{time}} \sim \text{N}(0, \sigma_{\text{time}}^2) \end{equation}

Model for multiple time periods: Interaction

yatâˆ¼Poisson(Î³atwat)logÎ³at=Î²aage+Î²atage:time\begin{align} y_{at} & \sim \text{Poisson}(\gamma_{at} w_{at}) \\ \log \gamma_{at} & = \beta_a^{\text{age}} + \beta_{at}^{\text{age:time}} \end{align}

Priors for age effect Î²aage\beta_a^{\text{age}} same as for single-time-period model

Prior for age-time effect Î²atage:time\beta_{at}^{\text{age:time}}:

ğ›ƒtage:timeâˆ¼N(ğ›ƒtâˆ’1age:time,Ïƒ2ğš½)\begin{equation} \pmb{\beta}_t^{\text{age:time}} \sim \text{N}(\pmb{\beta}_{t-1}^{\text{age:time}}, \sigma^2 \pmb{\Phi}) \end{equation} where ğš½=[1ÏÏ2â€¦ÏTâˆ’1Ï1Ïâ€¦ÏTâˆ’2Ï2Ï1â€¦ÏTâˆ’3â‹®â‹®â‹®â‹±â‹®ÏTâˆ’1ÏTâˆ’2ÏTâˆ’3â€¦1]\begin{equation} \pmb{\Phi} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & \rho & \rho^2 & \dots & \rho^{T-1} \\ \rho & 1 & \rho & \dots & \rho^{T-2} \\ \rho^2 & \rho & 1 & \dots & \rho^{T-3} \\ \vdots & \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \rho^{T-1} & \rho^{T-2} & \rho^{T-3} & \dots & 1 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}
